name: PowerCenter:Avoid overriding SQL
description:
This rule check for presence of SQL override in the following properties (where SQL override is  not recommended) :
Sql_Query
Lookup Sql Override
Update Override.
The only permitted properties with SQL override are Post_SQL and Pre_SQL (new behavior with PowerCenter package v2.2.1).
output:
This report lists all Mappings, Mapplet and Folders with Objects containing overriding SQL:
It provides the following information:
Mapping or Mapplet or Folder full name
The associated values are the child objects full name, child containing overriding SQL.
rationale:
For understandability, maintainability and scalability, overriding SQL should be avoided whenever possible. 
In case of change (Source, Target, Transformation rules), complex manual change are necessary with SQL override which consumme time and put the project at risk. 
In case of volume increase, complex manual change and SQL or RDBMS  complex optimization are necessary.
It is preferable to use the known, optimized and scalable standard PowerCenter technology. 
This practice can demonstrate a lack of knowledge on PowerCenter
remediation: When applicable, use the following properties : User Defined Join, Source filter, Number of Sorted Ports, Select Distinct in Properties dialog of Source Qualifier.
total: Total number of Mappings, Mapplets and Folders
